alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Crawford; Grant; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 14 at 9:50PM CST until December 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Historically Rare Very Strong Winds To Impact The Area... .Wind gusts later on Wednesday and Wednesday night will be historically rare. Some have not experienced such widespread high wind gusts. Winds are expected to increase later Wednesday afternoon with gusts of 35 to 40 mph. A line of storms will race through the area in the evening bringing the potential for localized wind gusts of 70 mph. Overnight, wind gusts to 65 mph will be widespread across the area, possibly causing more damage. ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...South winds increase in the late afternoon and gust to 35 mph...with southwest gusts to 65 mph overnight. Storms could produce higher gusts in the evening. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, southwest and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From 6 PM Wednesday to 6 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected which could mean the loss of home heating. Empty semi-trailers will run the risk of being blown over. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Crawford; Grant; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon
